titleStmt.title: Jilson Man et al. to Unknown
CWG9257

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned Justice of the Peace who presided at the trial of Daniel Lewis charged with a breach of the peace as stated in his affidavit Respectfully Joins in his prayer for a a remission of the fine and imprisonment

this day Daniel Lewis personally appeared before me the Justice of the peace without the above sd said march the 4 1861
Jilson Man J. P. W. C.
The undersigned members of the Jury who heard and decided said case also Join in his prayer for relief --

J. T. hayden
John ^his X mark^ Hall
Harrison ^his X mark^ Pinkston
William J Foster
Austin L Seay
Harrison Grouch
J J Seay
George Regon
R S
Obediah Childers
Hiram Beavers
